title: Leaf power
summary: In the mathematical area of graph theory, a k-leaf power of a tree T is a graph G whose vertices are the leaves of T and whose edges connect pairs of leaves whose distance in T is at most k. That is, G is an induced subgraph of the graph power T k {\displaystyle T^{k}} , induced by the leaves of T. For a graph G constructed in this way, T is called a k-leaf root of G.
